alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Mineral (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 03 at 2:58AM EST until February 04 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of western Maryland and eastern West Virginia, including the following areas: in western Maryland, Extreme Western Allegany and Garrett. In eastern West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Mineral. * WHEN...From this evening through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate rainfall is expected Thursday night with rainfall amounts around 1.5 inches most likely. The combination of the rainfall along with melting snow may cause creeks and streams to rise out of their banks as well as potential flooding in urban areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
